full_title: J CHRIST by Lil Nas X
title: J CHRIST

description.plain:
J CHRIST was Lil Nas X’s comeback single after a hiatus during his Tour Era. A snippet of the song was first previewed in a TikTok video on 9th December, 2023 where Lil Nas X said it was his favorite song. He continued to preview multiple snippets of it amongst various TikTok’s into early January where he announced its release for January 12th. Lil Nas X confirmed the song would release with a music video, which was premiered in various Churches across New York, Chicago, Houston and Los Angeles. He later confirmed there would be a “beloved popstar” feature who he has “been a fan of for a long time”, this later turned out to be a joke in a Tweet where he said “it was god”.

The music video follows Lil Nas X on a journey as Jesus and Moses. It starts with many celebrity doppelgängers lined up in a grassy area, leading towards the stairway to heaven. The camera then follows up the stairway to heaven and pictures Lil Nas X walking out of the gate into heaven. Lil Nas X is then shown in the underworld, challenging Satan to a basketball game in the very Colosseum where he was sent to prison in the MONTERO (Call Me By Your Name) music video. Lil Nas X then breaks Satan’s ankles, and wins the basketball game. The game finishes with a cheerleader group dancing. There is then a scene showing Lil Nas X crucified, before he is found as Saint Francis of Assisi, patron saint of animals, as frequently pictured, caring for sheep. He shears the sheep and uses the wool to create his outfit for the next scene where Lil Nas X is pictured at a red carpet fashion show, similar to the MET gala, until it’s interrupted by a news broadcast of a global flood warning. Lil Nas X then boards all his animals onto Noah’s Ark. The flood then reaches a city, fully submerging it, and there is a group dancing in the rain, before returning back to the ark now sailing away. The end of the video displays the ark sailing away with the caption “Day Zero A New Beginning” followed by a bible verse that reads “Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, He is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come. – 2 Corinthians 5:17”

Promotional posters were found in the streets of Paris on December, 26th, 2023, alongside a link to savenasx.com. Once you visit the website, there is a timer displaying how long it’s been since the release of his debut album MONTERO, and a prompt to sign up and “save Lil Nas X”.  This site claims to be dedicated to finding him and saving him by turning his heart toward Christ’s light. These posters were then found across more cities over the next week.

After the title being leaked by Soundcloud, on January 8th, 2024, the cover art and title for the song were revealed, along with a pre-save link. Two days later, on January 10th, 2024, Lil Nas X revealed a teaser towards his music video on all of his social media platforms. This features many celebrity doppelgängers lined up in a grassy area, leading towards the stairway to heaven. The video ends with a 5 second snippet, and all of the celebrities making it up to heaven.

Following the backlash of the music video, song title, cover art, and marketing, Lil Nas X responded on 15th, January, 2024, where he apologized for offending anybody and he stated he had no intentions of mocking Christianity.
